Ohhhhh CS:GO. . . .what a long and strange trip its been, eh?

The game has changed massively over the years, but always seems to improve upon the original CS formula (if you haven't played the original Counter-Strike, play that first and you'll understand). Better visuals, improved hit-detection and weapon-feel, sounds are on-point and everything just comes together to create the best Counter-Strike yet!

On the downside, since Valve's decision to make CS:GO free-to-play, the game is littered with hackers unless you are a Prime Member, meaning you have purchased the game prior to its FTP release, or you are above 'x' level and have a verified Steam account. Even then, you get the occasional hacker from time to time, but its to be expected in the world of competitive FPS shoosting (that's what Overwatch is for, just report those cheaters!)

Update: Glad to see we're still getting updates! Keep it up Valve!
